clinical_study.brief_title: Looking for Minimum Dose to Induce Sympathectomy in Infraclavicular Brachial Plexus Block
clinical_study.official_title: Looking for Minimum Dose to Induce Sympathectomy in Infraclavicular Brachial Plexus Block

brief_summary.textblock: For patients who undergoing hemodialysis, it is important to have good AV fistula. One third of AV fistula usually fail during early stage. It is helpful to use nerve block to dilate the blood vessels and enhance the prognosis. But 0.2% Ropivacaine usually cause muscle weakness in present studies. The investigators hope to find the lowest concentration to provide sympathectomy without muscle weakness. Because the patients with hemodialysis usually have multiple co-morbidity, thus we choose patients with forearm fracture at the first place. With this result, the investigators can design further study for patients with hemodialysis. The investigators prefer proximal approach because brachial plexus run together in the cosctoclavicular space and show lower incidence of incomplete work.

primary_outcome.measure: Change of diameter of basilic vein and brachial artery
primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline diameter(pre-nerve block) at 45min
primary_outcome.description: Use ultrasound to measure the difference of diameter at different time point.

primary_outcome.measure: Change of diameter of basilic vein and brachial artery
primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline diameter(pre-nerve block) at 24hour
primary_outcome.description: Use ultrasound to measure the difference of diameter at different time point.

primary_outcome.measure: Change of diameter of basilic vein and brachial artery
primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline diameter(pre-nerve block) at 48hour
primary_outcome.description: Use ultrasound to measure the difference of diameter at different time point.

secondary_outcome.description: A validated 3-point scale was used: 0 = no block (patient has normal sensation), 1 = patient can feel cold, but the sensation is reduced compared with the unblocked side, and 2 = complete anesthesia.
A validated 3-point scale was used: 0 = no block (patient has normal sensation), 1 = patient can feel cold, but the sensation is reduced compared with the unblocked side, and 2 = complete anesthesia.
A validated 3-point scale was used: 0 = no block (patient has normal power), 1 = patient can feel weakness with the unblocked side, and 2 = complete anesthesia.
A validated 3-point scale was used: 0 = no block (patient has normal power), 1 = patient can feel weakness with the unblocked side, and 2 = complete anesthesia.
A validated 3-point scale was used: 0 = no block (patient has normal power), 1 = patient can feel weakness with the unblocked side, and 2 = complete anesthesia.

clinical_study.condition: Finding the Minimum Dose to Induce Sympathectomy in Infraclavicular

study_pop.textblock: Patients who are scheduled for upper limb surgery

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age between 20-80 y/o, BW: 40-90 kilograms，ASA class I-III，No pre-existing neuropathy，Scheduled for upper limb surgery.
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Pre-existing neuropathy (ex: polyneuropathy)
2. History of allergy to xylocaine、ropivacaine、epinephrine
3. Emergent surgery
4. Coagulopathy
5. Patient who can not express themselves
